metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3240 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The pluto IKE daemon in libreswan before 3.15 and Openswan before 2.6.45, when built with NSS, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon restart) via a zero DH g^x value in a KE payload in a IKE packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3240` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libreswan - 3.19-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> affects openswan if compiled with NSS

criterions.comment: libreswan package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.19-1').
